title: Ancient Iran’s Human Rights Legacy Uncovered as Modern Regime Faces Global Criticism for Brutal Crackdown on Protesters
description: Ironically, Iran, which is today criticised for silencing critics and punishing protesters, gave the world its human rights charter. Cyrus the Great, the first king of ancient Persia, issued decrees that were codified into 'Cyrus Cylinder'. These decrees accorded basic human rights to people.

title: Open University drops ‘ancient Palestine’ reference after receiving complaint
description: Institution amends course material after receiving warning that terminology risks erasing Jewish history and harming Jewish students.

title: Is it right to accept money from organisations promoting the use of fossil fuels?
description: Agreement: I AgreeBody: Dear EditorThis article rightly criticises organisations which accept money from the fossil fuel industry.However, the BMJ is willing to accept money (for advertisements) from organisations advertising holidays which require long air flights.No competing Interests: YesThe following competing Interests: Electronic Publication Date: Friday, January 16, 2026 - 11:45AI use: No, I have not used AIHighwire Comment Subject: Carbon capture: the “distracting, dangerous scam” governments are relying on to reach net zeroWorkflow State: ReleasedFull Title: Is it right to accept money from organisations promoting the use of fossil fuels?Highwire Comment Response to: Carbon capture: the “distracting, dangerous scam” governments are relying on to reach net zeroCheck this box if you would like your letter to appear anonymously:: Last Name: GibsonFirst name and middle initial: Peter DEmail: petergibson@doctors.org.ukAddress: ManchesterOccupation: Retired GeriatricianBMJ: Additional Article Info: Rapid response
